thread.title: Portland airport workers see Seattle wage decision as a good omen
thread.title_full: Portland airport workers see Seattle wage decision as a good omen

author: Andy Giegerich
title: Portland airport workers see Seattle wage decision as a good omen
text:
Portland airport workers see Seattle wage decision as a good omen Aug 21, 2015, 6:49am PDT Industries & Tags Andy Giegerich Digital Managing Editor Portland Business Journal Andy Giegerich Digital Managing Editor Portland Business Journal Business Pulse Cathy Cheney | Portland Business Journal Portland's airport workers view yesterday's Washington court decision as a good omen. Portland International Airport workers say the decision to grant their Seattle peers a $15 minimum wage "adds fuel to the fire" in the income-equity world. The Washington State Supreme Court ruled that a voter-approved initiative to raise the minimum wage to $15 an hour in the city of SeaTac should apply to workers at the airport. The court, in a 5-4 vote, ruled Thursday that the city of SeaTacâ€™s voter approved $15-an-hour minimum wage law can be enforced at the Port of Seattle-owned airport. "We believe the Port of Portland has the power to follow the example of SeaTac and implement a minimum wage operating agreement with employers at PDX," said Meg Niemi , president of SEIU Local 49, which backs Portland's airport workers' organizing efforts. The Port of Seattle and SeaTac officials are reviewing the decision .
